1444036545766363137.text: By the conclusion of Cybersecurity Awareness Month, I hope that we will have achieved meaningful strides in treating cybersecurity as one of America’s most pressing issues today, so it will be a challenge of the past, tomorrow.

1444036542301888513.text: To my constituents, please take a moment to read this one pager with helpful tips to protect yourself and your data against cyber attacks, and please subscribe to my newsletter at https://t.co/fzwvFB7AzD to keep up to date on my latest cybersecurity legislation. https://t.co/dac5lMxHmW

1444036532860506112.text: As Chairwoman of the Cybersecurity, Infrastructure Protection, & Innovation Subcommittee, I have seen the necessity of resilient cybersecurity systems, and I know the steps we must take to deliver them.

1444036531472244737.text: The dangers and frequency of cyber attacks will only continue to escalate. The time to act is now. Congress must adequately consider any and all cyber legislation if we are to be prepared for challenges of the future. Full stop.

1444036529857482758.text: 🧵This October is Cybersecurity Awareness Month, which serves as a vital reminder of our need for modern and comprehensive cybersecurity systems commensurate with the threat cyber-and-ransomware attacks pose to our communities and our country.

- Stem the flow of PFAS contamination into the environment.
- Identify health risk associated with PFAS.
- Limit human exposure to PFAS.

..There is a critical need for more research into uterine fibroids and the burden placed on various racial and ethnic groups, especially Black and Brown women.

1379859884737449995.text:
This bill is supported by @blkwomenshealth, @FibroidFoun, @SWHR, @WeCan_WearWhite, and a host of notable other organizations. 

Co-Sponsoring this legislation w/ me: @RepRobinKelly @RepBonnie @repdavidscott @BennieGThompson @RepKClark @GKButterfield @RepSchrader ⤵️

1379859883848306688.text:
⚕️ Direct @HRSAgov to develop and disseminate fibroids information to health care providers;
💡The bill also highlights the need for improved patient and provider education surrounding the heightened risk for fibroids faced by women of color. ⤵️

1379859882057285639.text:
...compared to other racial groups their risk of developing uterine fibroids is three times greater. (@CBWGCAUCUS)
 
That is why I introduced:

#HR2007: The Stephanie Tubbs Jones Uterine Fibroid Research and Education Act of 2021.⤵️

1379859881121964035.text: #Uterinefibroids are noncancerous growths of the uterus. symptoms include severe menstrual bleeding, anemia, fatigue, pain, bladder or bowel dysfunction, impaired fertility, and pregnancy complications and loss. Black women tend to get fibroids at a younger age and suffer more ⤵️

1379859880241205248.text: ..Symptoms are debilitating, and existing treatment options can impact fertility. We need to do more research and expand what we know about uterine fibroids to better treat people for this condition. This research is critical for Black Women ⤵️

1379859879385530377.text: ... We are 2.4 times more likely to undergo hysterectomy and have a 6.8-fold increase of undergoing uterine-sparing myomectomy. This disease has ravaged the lives of women — particularly in the Black community — across the country ⤵️

1379859878416629760.text: An estimated 26 million individuals in the U.S., and approximately 25 % of Black women will suffer from Uterine Fibroids by the age of 25, and 80 % will have them by age 50. Additionally, Black women suffer from this pervasive ailment at a disproportionately earlier age! ⤵️

1379859877544218628.text: On #WorldHealthDay and #NationalPublicHealthWeek  2021, I want to highlight a public health issue that is dispositionally plaguing Black Women and girls #UterineFibroids. ⤵️ [A thread]

1029009719405555718.text: Dems will not stand idly by while the Trump Administration does NOTHING to address the humanitarian crisis in Central America - let's pass the #KeepFamiliesTogetherAct to protect asylum-seeking families. https://t.co/McBcKNhq9t

1029007190227607552.text: We cannot allow Trump to continue his destruction of families and government sanctioned child abuse - we need legislation like the #KeepFamiliesTogetherAct passed NOW.

1029004675633303553.text: Family separation has been condemned by child welfare experts, immigrations rights advocates, and medical professionals. Dems KNOW the only reason Trump is complying with family reunification is because he was ordered to do so by Federal Courts.

1027677178698321920.text: Update: Thank you to @verizon for your prompt response to my letter on the switch from copper lines to fiber optic cables in Brooklyn, an issue that matters to #NY09. https://t.co/ku3RO21dJf

1027604075976843267.text: The @OfficialCBC is fighting to restore our voting rights, empower workers, boost educational opportunities, improve access to affordable housing, and more. We know what's at risk for our commmunity- but that's why we know we can't, and won't, give up.

1027603944636403712.text: In 2016, Trump asked Black voters "What do you have to lose by voting for me?" Black voters knew the answer would be "A lot." We've lost more than we could have imagined - but the @OfficialCBC will not back down.

1027311666223099909.text: I am so grateful for the hard work of our District office interns here in Brooklyn. Thanks to @DelStateUniv @AmericanU and #HSTAT in Brooklyn for bringing their best and brightest students to #TeamClarke. https://t.co/pWnvIFiAHb

1027226696280358914.text: Nearly 70,000 people in my District are small business employees - their jobs and livelihoods are being threatened by the #GOPTaxScam's poor and underdeveloped policies.

1027226397801172992.text: The #GOPTaxScam will cost the federal government $2.3 TRILLION dollars. Who will bear the costs of this law? Small business owners.

1026936697689464832.text: I am deeply troubled by the brutality exhibited at a local nail salon in my District. No business owners or their employees should ever be allowed to attack, maim, or humiliate any customer. This type of behavior should not and will not be tolerated in our community. https://t.co/17HgHfNSSP

1026895926311444480.text: I support equal pay because I know the worth of a hard-working Black woman. We are the fastest growing entrepreneurs and the most educated group in this country. Our communities witness our impact, so we must be paid at our value. #BlackWomensEqualPayDay #DemandMore
